scaling.description: Assumes usage and data growth outpace original projections.
scaling.assumption: Traffic and data volume increase 10x within 18 months.
early_warning_signals: queue depth grows faster than traffic
cache hit ratio degrades over time
scaling.review_prompt: You are an architecture review board evaluating a system under scaling pressure. Given the architecture description, determine:  1. First bottleneck that will appear, 2. Why it fails first, 3. Early warning signal operators would see, 4. A concise list of scaling risks (max 3), Respond ONLY in JSON: { 'summary': '...', 'risks': ['...', '...']}

security_abuse.description: Assumes malicious usage, misconfiguration, and insider mistakes are inevitable.
security_abuse.assumption: Attackers are competent and internal misconfigurations will occur.
early_warning_signals: spikes in error rates tied to auth checks
monitoring blind spots in internal services
security_abuse.review_prompt: You are an adversarial security review board evaluating a system under active abuse and misconfiguration. Given the architecture description, determine: 1. The first security boundary that fails or is exploited, 2. Why it fails before other defenses, 3. The earliest observable signal defenders would see, 4. A concise list of security and abuse risks (max 3). Assume attackers are competent and internal misconfiguration is inevitable. Respond ONLY in JSON: { "summary": "...", "risks": ["...", "..."] }

regulatory_compliance.description: Assumes regulatory requirements change after the system is in production.
regulatory_compliance.assumption: New compliance or audit requirements appear with short notice.
failure_modes: hard-coded data flows that violate residency rules
lack of separation between operational and audit data
early_warning_signals: audit requests require manual data reconstruction
regulatory_compliance.review_prompt: You are a regulatory and compliance review board evaluating a system after new non-negotiable requirements are imposed. Given the architecture description, determine: 1. The first design decision that violates or complicates compliance, 2. Why it becomes non-compliant before other components, 3. The earliest signal that compliance teams or auditors would notice, 4. A concise list of regulatory and compliance risks (max 3). Assume requirements arrive late and retroactive compliance is mandatory. Respond ONLY in JSON: { "summary": "...", "risks": ["...", "..."] }
